instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.PM_PCH_PWROK: What is PM_PCH_PWROK? PM_PCH_PWROK is usually created by U1950, a 74LVC2G08GT chip and is necessary for the machine to wake from an S5 and S4 state and turn on. This signal will be present if ALL_SYS_PWRGD, CPU_VR_PGOOD, PP3V3_S0, and PP3V42_G3H are present. When this signal is not present or intermittent, usually pin 8 on U1950 for PP3V42_G3H is corroded..
definitions.P3V3S3_EN: What is P3V3S3_EN? P3V3S3_EN is a signal that turns on the PP3V3_S3 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .
definitions.C1802: What is C1802? Capacitor to ground on PCH_SRTCRST_L on machines from 2009-2012, PCH_SRTCRST_L needs to be high for PCH to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .
definitions.C1803: What is C1803? Capacitor to ground on RTC_RESET_L on machines from 2009-2012, RTC_RESET_L needs to be high for system to not be in RTC reset mode, this capacitor can become corroded or leaky and result in this signal being pulled low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
job from angry customer, job sat in repair queue for 4 weeks, demanded macbook back, refused to pay for return shipping, sat here for the last 6 months.
possible vomit damage, was ultrasonic before working on it due to the smell
no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>,  <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, 12.53.       <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>, 3.482,               pp5vs5, 4.963,     <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>,  3.302        <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL>,  0.552
no s3 rails present, because of <SIGNAL>PM_SLP</SIGNAL>
<SIGNAL>PM_PCH_PWROK</SIGNAL> 0v   
after reflowing the smc i now have <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>   
now i get
all s5, plus, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> 0.5v (no short to ground)  <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S3</SIGNAL> 0v <SIGNAL>P3V3S3_EN</SIGNAL> 0v 
checked <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> again and now is 0v again

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Could be anything depending on where corrosion was.

Could still be crap under SMC or PCH. Check voltage on <CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR>/03. Was there crap around <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>, if so replace it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
<CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR> 3.272
<CAPACITOR>C1803</CAPACITOR> 3.306 
replaced the <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> with a <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> from a 2936
<CAPACITOR>C1802</CAPACITOR> 3.581
<CAPACITOR>C1803</CAPACITOR> 2.6 - 3.3 up and down

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Now look up the difference between 2936 and 3115 clock chip!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: i did, the pinouts are the same, the lines coming in and out are the same, from what i can tell its the same chip

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message: if they were even a bit different i wouldnt have used it

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
One is the A version and the other V version. Why take the risk of there being some small internal difference? \

I still suspect crap under the SMC too.
